alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 2:29PM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches at lower elevations, 8 to 13 inches in higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 12 inches possible with higher amounts in the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Elk City, Highway 12 Lowell to Lolo Pass, Pierce, Dixie, Elk River, and Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains
